D03CDBF0DFE301314A5B68A86D17958E.description: Conduct exercises for actors in sensory recall.

D03C75E0DFE301314A5A68A86D17958E.description: Lead small groups in planning a scene and rehearsing the scene for in-class performance.

D03C2010DFE301314A5968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate leadership skills in small group work.

D03BC7B0DFE301314A5868A86D17958E.description: Lead peers in warm-ups and theatre games.

comments: Directing is the process of conceptualizing, organizing, and leading a collaborative process with the intent of performance.

D03A8090DFE301314A5568A86D17958E.description: Execute the duties and responsibilities of a dramaturg.

D03A2A40DFE301314A5468A86D17958E.description: Compare and integrate art forms by analyzing traditional theatre, dance, music, visual arts, and other art forms.

D039D5E0DFE301314A5368A86D17958E.description: Write and revise a full-length script.

D038C5B0DFE301314A5068A86D17958E.description: Develop and sustain a portfolio of best works that illuminate and reflect growth and knowledge as a playwright.

D0386C20DFE301314A4F68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the duties and responsibilities of a dramaturg.

D0380DF0DFE301314A4E68A86D17958E.description: Collaborate as a playwright with a director, actors, and designers to develop original scripts for formal and informal theatre and electronic media productions.

D0392970DFE301314A5168A86D17958E.description: Create a script through improvisation and devised scenes based on personal experience, heritage, imagination, literature, and/or history.

D03782C0DFE301314A4D68A86D17958E.description: Write and revise a script based on real life characters and situations that demonstrate an understanding of play structure.

D03723B0DFE301314A4C68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the use of observation from nature, society, or research as a means to enhance an original script.

D0366080DFE301314A4A68A86D17958E.description: Dramatize and document, both individually and in groups, scenarios that develop theme, plot, conflict, and dialogue.

D0360C80DFE301314A4968A86D17958E.description: Dramatize and document scenes based on life experiences using a variety of conflicts to create resolution to the story.

D035B630DFE301314A4868A86D17958E.description: Dramatize and document scenes using a variety of characters to develop monologues and/or dialogue.

D0355880DFE301314A4768A86D17958E.description: Adapt a short, non-dramatic literary selection (e.g., folktale, poem, life story) into a scripted dramatic format.

D0349A50DFE301314A4568A86D17958E.description: Describe or illustrate recalled sensory experiences to create characters and plot.

D0343C00DFE301314A4468A86D17958E.description: Create original, brief stories through improvisation that include a storyline and characters.

D033B3D0DFE301314A4368A86D17958E.description: Improvise by imitating life experiences, knowledge of literature, social issues, and/or historical situations, and create imaginary scenes that include characters, setting, and storyline.

D03344E0DFE301314A4268A86D17958E.description: Retell a story including its theme, setting, storyline, plot, physical descriptions of the characters, and theme.

D032E480DFE301314A4168A86D17958E.description: Identify various sources (e.g., books, family stories, nature, imagination, paintings, poetry) for theatrical work.

comments: Playwriting is the process of conceptualizing, devising, improvising, developing, writing, and revising original written work for the stage and other media.

D031BA80DFE301314A3E68A86D17958E.description: Collaborate with directors to develop concepts that convey the metaphorical nature of the drama for theatre, film/video, and electronic media productions.

D0314520DFE301314A3D68A86D17958E.description: Design and implement coherent stage management, promotion, and business plans.

D030EE50DFE301314A3C68A86D17958E.description: Implement costume and make-up designs for a dramatic work in a formal setting

D0309570DFE301314A3B68A86D17958E.description: Implement sound designs for a dramatic work in a formal setting.

D0303F50DFE301314A3A68A86D17958E.description: Implement lighting designs for a dramatic work in a formal theatre setting.

D02FE1E0DFE301314A3968A86D17958E.description: Implement and build from original ground plans the set designs for a dramatic work.

D02F24D0DFE301314A3768A86D17958E.description: Develop and sustain a portfolio of best works that illuminate and reflect growth, knowledge, and skills as a theatrical technician/designer.

D02ED050DFE301314A3668A86D17958E.description: Incorporate the use of technological advances in theatre and other disciplines in creating formal and informal theatre, film/video, and electronic media productions.

D02E7B20DFE301314A3568A86D17958E.description: Create and reliably implement production schedules, stage management plans, promotional ideas, and business/front-of-house procedures for theatre, film/video, and electronic media productions.

D02E1C70DFE301314A3468A86D17958E.description: Design and/or implement technical elements for theatre, film/video, and electronic media productions based on designs from a concept and collaboration with a director.

D02DABD0DFE301314A3368A86D17958E.description: Execute the duties and responsibilities of a crew head and/or crew member to stage a variety of dramatic works.

D02D46A0DFE301314A3268A86D17958E.description: Design original costume renderings and make-up charts for a variety of dramatic works.

D02CEDD0DFE301314A3168A86D17958E.description: Design an original sound plot for a variety of dramatic works.

D02C7940DFE301314A3068A86D17958E.description: Design an original lighting plot for a variety of dramatic works.

D02BFF60DFE301314A2F68A86D17958E.description: Design original ground plans and set designs for a variety of dramatic works.

D02BA000DFE301314A2E68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the use of observation from nature, society or research as a means to enhance the script, performance or design.

D02AF340DFE301314A2C68A86D17958E.description: Develop technical designs based on design concepts (musical and visual art principles) that meet the requirements of the dramatic work, film/video, and electronic media production.

D02A9A10DFE301314A2B68A86D17958E.description: Use standard procedures to efficiently and safely operate tools and equipment for technical aspects of formal and informal theatre, film/video, and electronic media productions.

D02A3D50DFE301314A2A68A86D17958E.description: Create costume drawings and/or make-up charts.

D029DF40DFE301314A2968A86D17958E.description: Create sound effects and select music to enhance a scene or production.

D0298870DFE301314A2868A86D17958E.description: Use available lighting sources to enhance formal and informal theatre, film/video, and electronic media productions to create design elements.

D0292D70DFE301314A2768A86D17958E.description: Construct or locate appropriate props to enhance a scene or production.

D0285AB0DFE301314A2568A86D17958E.description: Use available art materials, tools, and/or stock scenery (e.g., rehearsal blocks, puppets, curtains, backdrops) to create and convey props and/or setting.

D027F3C0DFE301314A2468A86D17958E.description: Implement technical theatre etiquette in rehearsal and production settings.

D0279B00DFE301314A2368A86D17958E.description: Develop designs that use visual and aural elements to convey environments that clearly support the text.

D026E560DFE301314A2168A86D17958E.description: Use available art materials, tools, and resources to convey the characters through costumes, accessories, and make-up designs for a scene or production.

D02687F0DFE301314A2068A86D17958E.description: Select/document/arrange materials (e.g., props, furniture, costumes, sound) to create the setting/environment of the story to be dramatized.

D0262BB0DFE301314A1F68A86D17958E.description: Illustrate the use of line, shape, texture, color, space, and balance to represent the environment of a story.

D025D7B0DFE301314A1E68A86D17958E.description: Establish a playing space and an audience space.

D0257FF0DFE301314A1D68A86D17958E.description: Describe and/or document the setting/environment of a story to be dramatized (e.g., through words, drawings, technical elements).

comments: Theatre technology uses craft skills, knowledge of design, equipment, and materials to construct the elements necessary for the visual and aural aspects of production that serve the script and the action.

D02471B0DFE301314A1A68A86D17958E.description: Compare and demonstrate various acting techniques and methods (e.g., stage, on-camera, film), individually or in an ensemble, to create and sustain characters that communicate with audiences in formal and informal theatre, television, film/video, and other electronic media productions.

D0241930DFE301314A1968A86D17958E.description: Develop a repertory of audition selections from classical and contemporary plays.

D0234A90DFE301314A1768A86D17958E.description: Develop and maintain a portfolio of best personal works that exhibit and reflect growth and knowledge as an actor (e.g., DVD of performances, photographs, resume).

D022F0E0DFE301314A1668A86D17958E.description: Use sensory recall as an actor to portray a production concept in a unified production.

D0229260DFE301314A1568A86D17958E.description: Compare and demonstrate various acting techniques and methods (e.g., stage, on-camera, film), individually or in an ensemble, to create and sustain characters that communicate with audiences in formal and informal theatre, television, film/video, and other electronic media productions.

D0223E00DFE301314A1468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the use of observation from nature, society, or research as a means to enhance a performance.

D021E6F0DFE301314A1368A86D17958E.description: Work individually and in an ensemble to create characters for theatre and/or other media productions (e.g., for classical, contemporary, realistic, and nonrealistic improvisations and scripted plays).

D0210A60DFE301314A1168A86D17958E.description: Implement theatre etiquette in rehearsal and production settings.

D020A520DFE301314A1068A86D17958E.description: Communicate sensory images through movement, vocal, visual, or written expression

D0204920DFE301314A0F68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate mental and physical attributes required to communicate characters different from themselves (e.g., concentration, sense recall, ability to remember lines and cues, breath and vocal control, body alignment, flexibility, and coordination).

D01FF320DFE301314A0E68A86D17958E.description: As a character, play out her/his wants by interacting with others, maintaining concentration, and contributing to the action of classroom improvisations (e.g., scenes based on personal experience and heritage, imagination, literature, and history).

D01F99C0DFE301314A0D68A86D17958E.description: Work individually to create characters for theatre and/or other media productions (e.g., for classical, contemporary, realistic, and nonrealistic improvisations and scripted plays).

D01EDCB0DFE301314A0B68A86D17958E.description: Work cooperatively and follow established safety rules.

D01E7610DFE301314A0A68A86D17958E.description: Describe or illustrate recalled sensory experiences.

D01E0F20DFE301314A0968A86D17958E.description: Sustain a scene using appropriate language or movement with the teacher role-playing or giving clues (e.g., from literature or students' personal experiences).

D01DB6B0DFE301314A0868A86D17958E.description: Imagine and describe characters, their relationships, what they want and why (e.g., through variations of movement and gesture, vocal pitch, volume, and tempo).

comments: Acting is the process and art of representing a character in the classroom, on stage, or in other media.

D01B83B0DFE301314A0268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate artistic discipline to achieve an ensemble in rehearsal and performance.

D01B1970DFE301314A0168A86D17958E.description: Collaborate to design and choose the environmental elements for a scenario/script.

D01AC750DFE301314A0068A86D17958E.description: Collaborate to create a documented script.

D019CE20DFE3013149FD68A86D17958E.description: Collaborate and communicate in the rehearsal process.

D0197050DFE3013149FC68A86D17958E.description: Collaborate to design and choose the environmental elements for a scenario/script.

D01911A0DFE3013149FB68A86D17958E.description: Collaborate to create a scenario/script as a team.

D0180050DFE3013149F868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to collaborate while coming to consensus in the dramatic process.

D0172C70DFE3013149F668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate respect for others' opinions by respectfully listening while ideas are articulated.

comments: Collaboration includes working jointly, cooperating, negotiating, and articulating ideas to reach consensus that forms theatrical art.
The processes and experiences developed related to theatre.
